sen.j: 江戸時代後期に開国し、明治新政府が成立した日本では1868年（慶応4年）12月19日に新政権樹立の通告と国交と通商を求める国書を持つ使者を李氏朝鮮政府に送った。
sen.e: In the second half of the Edo period, Japan opened its secluded economy to the world, and the New Meiji Government sent to the government of the Joseon Dynasty an envoy holding a letter with the sovereign's message which informed of the founding of a new administration of Japan, requested to establish relations and start to trade with them on December 19, 1868.

In the second half of the Edo period, Japan opened its secluded economy to the world, and the New Meiji Government sent to the government of the Joseon Dynasty an envoy holding a letter with the sovereign's message which informed them of the founding of a new administration of Japan and requested to establish relations and start to trade on December 19, 1868.
sen.cmt: ・アポストロフィが全角のようでしたので修正しました。・informとofの間は伝える相手が必要なためthemを追加しました。・trade with themのthemが何を指すか曖昧であり、この形では日本と李氏朝鮮政府を指すことはできないため、tradeを自動詞扱いに変えました。・startが並ぶものはestablishのようですが、現状のコンマとandの使い方ではそれが適切に表現できていないため修正しました。
sen.e: In the second half of the Edo period, Japan opened its secluded economy to the world, and the New Meiji Government sent to the government of the Joseon Dynasty an envoy holding a letter with the sovereign's message which informed them of the founding of a new administration of Japan and requested to establish relations and start to trade on December 19, 1868.

sen.j: しかし国書の中に「皇」「勅」の文字が入っており、冊封体制下では「皇」は中国の皇帝にのみ許される称号であり、「勅」は中国皇帝の詔勅を意味していたので、朝鮮側は受け取りを拒否した。
sen.e: However, Joseon Dynasty refused to receive the letter because it contained the Chinese characters '皇' (Royal, imperial) and '勅' (imperial decree) though '皇' was allowed to use only for the Chinese emperor and '勅' signified the imperial rescript under the tributary system.

However, the Joseon Dynasty refused to receive the letter because it contained the Chinese characters '皇' (Royal, imperial) and '勅' (imperial decree) despite the fact that '皇' was allowed to be used only for the Chinese emperor and '勅' signified the imperial rescript under the tributary system.
sen.cmt: ・Joseon Dynastyは定冠詞が必要です。・クォーテーションマークが全角のようですので修正しました。・括弧の中の余分なスペースを削除しました。・was allowed to useは、useの主語が'皇'になってしまうため、was allowed to be usedとしました。・この場合、逆接の文ではないため、thoughは不適切です。逆接ではなく、「～にもかかわらず」のニュアンスが適切と思われますので、despite the fact thatに修正しました。
sen.e: However, the Joseon Dynasty refused to receive the letter because it contained the Chinese characters '皇' (Royal, imperial) and '勅' (imperial decree) despite the fact that '皇' was allowed to be used only for the Chinese emperor and '勅' signified the imperial rescript under the tributary system.

sen.j: その後何度も国書を送ったが、朝鮮側はその都度受け取りを拒否した（書契問題）。
sen.e: After that, Japan sent the letter with sovereign's message to them again and again, but Joseon Dynasty refused to receive on every occasion (it is called Shokei Mondai, the problem of letters).
After that, Japan sent them the letter with the sovereign's message again and again, but the Joseon Dynasty refused to receive on every occasion (it is called Shokei Mondai, the problem of letters.)
sen.cmt: ・sovereignには定冠詞が必要です。・クォーテーションマークが全角のようですので修正しました。・to themは、その直前の部分の長さと比較してかなり短いため、先に持ってくるのが自然と思われますので、そのように修正しました。・Joseon Dynastyには定冠詞が必要です。・括弧の中の余分なスペースを削除しました。・最後の括弧の中が文形式なので、指示に従ってピリオドを括弧の中に入れました。
sen.e: After that, Japan sent them the letter with the sovereign's message again and again, but the Joseon Dynasty refused to receive on every occasion (it is called Shokei Mondai, the problem of letters.)

sen.j: 日本側は、先に清国と日清修好条規を締結する。
sen.e: So Japan first concluded the Japan-Qing Treaty of Friendship with Qing.
So Japan first concluded the Japan-Qing Treaty of Friendship with Qing.

sen.j: その後、日本と清国の間で領土問題（台湾出兵参照）が発生し、日本の強硬な態度に驚いた清国は朝鮮に国書の受け入れ交渉をするよう指示した。
sen.e: Afterward, the territorial problem occurred between Japan and Qing (see also: The Taiwan Expedition), then Qing feared Japan's strong attitude and they suggested Joseon Dynasty to receive the letter.

Afterward, the territorial problem occurred between Japan and Qing (see also The Taiwan Expedition), then Qing feared Japan's strong attitude and they directed the Joseon Dynasty to receive the letter.

sen.e: Afterward, the territorial problem occurred between Japan and Qing (see also The Taiwan Expedition), then Qing feared Japan's strong attitude and they directed the Joseon Dynasty to receive the letter.

sen.j: ここで交渉は再開されるはずであったが、1872年（明治5年）5月外務省官吏・相良正樹は、交渉が進展しない事にしびれを切らし、それまで外出を禁じられていた草梁倭館（対馬藩の朝鮮駐在事務所）を出て、東莱府へ出向き、府使との会見を求めた（倭館欄出）。
sen.e: On this occasion, the negotiation was going to be reopened, but 相良正樹, the government official of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, lost his patience because the negotiation was not proceeded at all, so he went to Toraifu, although he was prohibited to go out of Choryang-dong Wakan (the residence office of the Tsushima clan), and he demanded to meet with an ambassador of Toraifu in May of 1872 (go out of Wakan).
sen.cmt: 相良正樹：読み方不明 倭館欄出：定訳不明

sen.j: さらに同年9月、それまで対馬藩が管理していた草梁倭館を日本公館と改名し外務省に直接管理させることにした。
sen.e: Further, in September of the same year, the name of this consulate was changed by Japan side from Choryang-dong Wakan to Nihon Kokan (Japanese Consulate) and they also had the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to manage this consulate in place of the Tsushima clan.

sen.e: Further, in September of the same year, the name of this consulate was changed by Japan from Choryang-dong Wakan to Nihon Kokan (Japanese Consulate) and they also had the Ministry of Foreign Affairs manage this consulate in place of the Tsushima clan.

sen.j: これは草梁倭館は、朝鮮政府が対馬藩の為に建て使用を認めた施設だったこと、対馬藩は日本と朝鮮の間の交渉窓口の立場にあったからである。
sen.e: Choryang-dong Wakan was built by the Korean government as the facility for the Tsushima clan so they were allowed to use there, the Tsushima clan was in a position of the window to negotiate between Japan and Korea, therefore Japan did the above acts.

This is because Choryang-dong Wakan was built by the Korean government as the facility for the Tsushima clan, the Tsushima clan was in a position of the window to negotiate between Japan and Korea, therefore Japan did the above acts.
sen.cmt: ・「あったからである」の訳が日本語の論理のままで不自然なため修正しました。・「使用を認めた」の訳が不自然なため修正しました。
sen.e: This is because Choryang-dong Wakan was built by the Korean government as the facility for the Tsushima clan, the Tsushima clan was in a position of the window to negotiate between Japan and Korea, therefore Japan did the above acts.

sen.j: この日本側の措置に東莱府使は激怒して、10月には日本公館への食糧等の供給を停止、日本人商人による貿易活動の停止を行った。
sen.e: Toraifu side was so angered these acts that they stopped supply of food to Nihon Kokan, and also prohibited to trade Japanese traders.
Toraifu side was so angered by these acts that they stopped supply of food etc. to Nihon Kokan and also prohibited the trading activities by Japanese traders.
sen.cmt: ・angeredの後にはbyが必要です。・食糧等の「等」が訳出されていませんのでetc.を追加しました。・prohibit toとは書けませんので、prohibited the trading activities by Japanese tradersとしました。・and alsoの前のコンマは不要です。
sen.e: Toraifu side was so angered by these acts that they stopped supply of food etc. to Nihon Kokan and also prohibited the trading activities by Japanese traders.

sen.j: かつてはこの時に「侮日掲示」を朝鮮側が行ったとされ、実際に明治日本側にそう報告されたが、近年の研究ではその報告書の記述が作為であったことが明らかとなっている。
sen.e: In those days, it was said that Korea did 'an insulting act against Japan' and was reported this to Japan side, but according to present study, it is cleared that this description of the report was an artificiality one.

Previously, it was said that on this occasion Korea did 'an insulting act against Japan,' which was reported to Japan side, but according to recent studies, it is cleared that this description of the report was an artificiality one.
sen.cmt: ・In those daysは指す対象が上記の文の時になりますが、実際はその後の時期の「かつて」の時になるためPreviouslyとしました。・「この時に」が訳漏れです。・クォーテーションマークが全角のようですので修正しました。・was reported this to Japan sideは意味が不明なため、修正しました。・present studyは「近年の研究」とは少しずれるためrecent studiesとしました。
sen.e: Previously, it was said that on this occasion Korea did 'an insulting act against Japan,' which was reported to Japan side, but according to recent studies, it is cleared that this description of the report was an artificiality one.

sen.j: しかし、いずれにしても日本側の感情を逆撫でする効果は十分にあり、「征韓論」が巻き起こるに至った。
sen.e: However, these Toraifu's dealings had enough effect to stroke Japan's fur the wrong way, and it brought Seikanron in Japan.
However, these Toraifu's dealings had enough effect to stroke Japan's fur the wrong way, and it brought 'Seikanron' (insistence on making Korea open to the world by military power) in Japan.
sen.cmt: ・アポストロフィが全角ですので修正しました。・引用符が抜けていたため追加しました。・「征韓論」の補足説明を加えました。
sen.e: However, these Toraifu's dealings had enough effect to stroke Japan's fur the wrong way, and it brought 'Seikanron' (insistence on making Korea open to the world by military power) in Japan.

sen.j: 交渉が暗礁に乗り上げると、日本では朝鮮出兵を求める征韓論争など出兵問題が政治問題化するようになる。
sen.e: When the negotiation came up against unexpected difficulties, the issue of the dispatch of troops, like Seikanron, which demands the dispatch of troops to Korea, became a political issue in Japan.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・「暗礁に乗り上げる」はstoppedだけでは不十分なため修正しました。・ここでの問題はproblemというよりもissueであると思われます。・look forはここではそぐわないと思われます。原文に合わせてdemandとしました。・disputeが朝鮮出兵を求めるというのは不自然なので、前述の征韓論の補足説明で書いたとおり、内容をinsistenceとすることでdisputeを削除しました。
sen.e: When the negotiation came up against unexpected difficulties, the issue of the dispatch of troops, like Seikanron, which demands the dispatch of troops to Korea, became a political issue in Japan.

sen.j: 征韓論争は明治6年の政変によって「延期」（「中止」ではない）と決まった。
sen.e: In 1873, the political change occurred and, as a result, it was decided to 'postpone' the Seikanron dispute (not to 'stop'), however, after that, the Taiwan expedition occurred and further it was informed that Heungseon Daewongun downfalled in Korea, so in view of these facts, the Meiji Government decided to observe Korea's condition.

sen.e: In 1873, the political change occurred and, as a result, it was decided to 'postpone' (not 'stop') the Seikanron dispute.

sen.j: しかし、その後の台湾出兵の発生と大院君失脚の報によって征韓論の勢いが弱まったために、明治政府は政府間交渉をして相手の状況をみることとした。
sen.e: However, because Seikanron lost its momentum due to the occurrence of the Taiwan expedition and the downfall of Heungseon Daewongun in Korea, the Meiji Government decided to observe Korea's condition.

sen.j: さらに朝鮮政府の中央では大院君の支持者が交渉中止を求めたために議論が紛糾し、東莱政府も確実な回答を日本側に伝えることが不可能となっていた。

sen.j: 結果的に、李氏朝鮮外交に翻弄された日本政府は、遂に痺れを切らし、小艦を釜山に派遣し東莱府館員を艦上に招待し発砲演習を見せつけることにより、局面打開を図った。
sen.e: The Japanese government was at the mercy of the Joseon Dynasty's diplomacy and they lost their patience at last, so they made a breakthrough; dispatched a small warship to Pusan and invited the members of Toraifu on board to show the shooting exercises.

sen.j: 強硬派から（マシュー・ペリー同様嫌がらせのために）測量や航路研究のためとし朝鮮近海に軍艦を派遣して軍事的威圧を加える案が出ると、外務大輔の寺島宗則は太政大臣三条実美や右大臣岩倉具視の了承を得てこれを承認した。
sen.e: The hard-liners of Japan suggested Munenori TERASHIMA, Gaimu-taifu (post of Foreign Ministry) to dispatch a warship to inshore of Korea in the name of measuring the coastline and investigating passages (for harass them as well as Matthew (Calbraith) PERRY did), and he accepted it under the approval of Sanetomi SANJO, the Grand Minister and Tomomi IWAKURA, Minister of the Right, then he commanded Sumiyoshi KAWAMURA to dispatch two warships; "Unyo" and "Dainiteibo".

sen.j: 海軍大輔川村純義に『雲揚 (軍艦)』『第二丁卯』の2隻の軍艦を派遣させる。
sen.e: Accordingly, Munenori TERASHIMA commanded Sumiyoshi KAWAMURA, Navy taifu (vice-minister), to dispatch two warships: "Unyo" and "Dainiteibo."
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・指示に従って、ピリオドをクォーテーションマークの中に入れました。・クォーテーションマークが全角のようですので修正しました。・訳漏れです（「海軍大輔」）・具体的に説明する名詞を続けて並列する場合、セミコロンではなくコロンが適切です。
sen.e: Accordingly, Munenori TERASHIMA commanded Sumiyoshi KAWAMURA, Navy taifu (vice-minister), to dispatch two warships: "Unyo" and "Dainiteibo."

sen.j: 日本の軍艦は5月25日に無許可で釜山へ入港し、射撃演習などの威嚇行為を行った。
sen.e: On 25th May, Japanese warship sailed into Pusan without Korean permission and threatened Korea with showing the shooting exercise etc.
On May 25, Japanese warship sailed into Pusan without Korean permission and threatened Korea by showing the shooting exercise etc.
sen.cmt: ・日付の書き方が不適切だったため修正しました。・with showingとは書けませんので修正しました。
sen.e: On May 25, Japanese warship sailed into Pusan without Korean permission and threatened Korea by showing the shooting exercise etc.

sen.j: これに朝鮮側は抗議を行った。
sen.e: Korea protested against these acts.
Korea protested against these acts.
Korea protested against these acts.

sen.j: これについて、従来の学説では1875年9月20日、日本の海軍少佐井上良馨が雲揚で航海していた。
sen.e: About this, according to the traditional theory, it was said that Yoshika INOUE, the navy major transferred a small boat from the Japanese warship Unyo and approached the land displaying the national flag of Japan in search of drinkable water, and when he reached at Chojijin in Ganghwa Island, Korean garrison opened fire toward them from the third gun battery placed on Ganghwa Island, so he hurriedly came back to the Unyo and attacked and destroyed the gun batteries of the Island, then occupied the fort of the EisoJoto island.
Regarding this incident, the traditional theory says that Yoshika INOUE, navy major, was sailing on the Japanese warship Unyo.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・navy majorは肩書ですので定冠詞は削除しました。・表現が不自然なため修正しました。
sen.e: Regarding this incident, the traditional theory says that Yoshika INOUE, navy major, was sailing on the Japanese warship Unyo.

sen.j: 飲料水の欠乏により淡水補給のため、自らボートに乗りこみ水を求めに陸に向かっていた。
sen.e: To supply fresh water against shortage of drinkable water, Inoue himself boarded a small boat from the Japanese warship Unyo and was approaching the land.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・表現が不自然なため修正しました。
sen.e: To supply fresh water against shortage of drinkable water, Inoue himself boarded a small boat from the Japanese warship Unyo and was approaching the land.

sen.j: 日本国旗を掲げながら江華島の草芝鎮沖にさしかかった際に、島に設置された第3砲台から砲撃を受けた。
sen.e: When they reached the offshore of Chojijin in Ganghwa Island, displaying the national flag of Japan in search of drinkable water, Korean garrison opened fire toward them from the third gun battery placed on Ganghwa Island.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・表現が不自然なため修正しました。
sen.e: When they reached the offshore of Chojijin in Ganghwa Island, displaying the national flag of Japan in search of drinkable water, Korean garrison opened fire toward them from the third gun battery placed on Ganghwa Island.

sen.j: そのため、急ぎ雲楊へ帰艦し江華島砲台を破壊、永宗城島の要塞を占領した、とされてきた。
sen.e: So he hurriedly came back to the Unyo and attacked and destroyed the gun batteries of the Island; then, he occupied the fort of the EisoJoto island.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・thenは接続詞ではないため、セミコロンを追加しました。
sen.e: So he hurriedly came back to the Unyo and attacked and destroyed the gun batteries of the Island; then, he occupied the fort of the EisoJoto island.

sen.j: しかし近年新資料が発見され、この説は訂正を余儀なくされた。
sen.e: However, in these days, the new material was found and it was inevitable to correct this theory.
However, in these days, the new material was found and it was inevitable to correct this theory.
However, in these days, the new material was found and it was inevitable to correct this theory.

sen.j: もともと従来の説の根拠とされた雲揚の公式報告書（10月）は、日朝間の交戦期間をたった1日の間に起きたことのように記し（実際には3日間）、史料の信頼性に疑義が提出されていた。
sen.e: Originally there was a doubt the reliability of the traditional theory, because in the official report (October) which was based on the traditional theory, it was written that Japan and Korea battled for one day (actually for three days), but in previous official report (September) which were submitted nine days after the incident, it was mentioned that Japan approached Korea's camp by warship to meet the Korea's bureaucracy for the purpose of measuring and so on, and when they advanced more (toward Seoul), they were attacked from Korea's gun battery.

There was a doubt about the reliability of the traditional theory, because the official report (October) of Unyo, on which the traditional theory was based, originally describes that Japan and Korea battled for only one day (three days in reality).
sen.cmt: ・doubtの後には、この場合前置詞が必要です。・括弧の中の余分なスペースを削除しました。・based onの関係が逆です。・actuallyはNG用語です。・「もともと」の係り先は「記し」と思われますので修正しました。・1文が長すぎるため分割しました。・「たった」の訳漏れです。・一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There was a doubt about the reliability of the traditional theory, because the official report (October) of Unyo, on which the traditional theory was based, originally describes that Japan and Korea battled for only one day (three days in reality).

sen.j: しかし、事件から9日後に提出された公式報告書（9月）では、測量等のために朝鮮側の官僚と面会しようとして武装端艇でその陣営近くまで遡航し、さらに朝鮮側に断ることなく奥（ソウル方面）へと進もうとして砲台から砲撃されたと記されていた。
sen.e: However, the official report (September) which was submitted nine days after the incident describes that Japan approached Korea's camp by warship to meet the Korea's bureaucrats for the purpose of measuring and so on, and when they advanced more (toward Seoul) without permission from Korea, they were attacked from Korea's gun battery.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・アポストロフィが全角ですので修正しました。・「官僚」はbureaucratです。・「朝鮮側に断ることなく」が訳漏れです。
sen.e: However, the official report (September) which was submitted nine days after the incident describes that Japan approached Korea's camp by warship to meet the Korea's bureaucrats for the purpose of measuring and so on, and when they advanced more (toward Seoul) without permission from Korea, they were attacked from Korea's gun battery.

sen.j: 軍船が他国の河川を無断で遡航することは国際法違反であり、この場合さらに首都方面に行こうとしたことから、日本軍の行動は挑発だったと考えられている。
sen.e: Sailing the rivers of foreign countries without permission is a violation of the international laws, and in this case, it was assumed that the Japanese army's act was provocation against Korea in view of the situation they were going to capital city.

Sailing the rivers of foreign countries without permission is a violation of the international laws, and in this case, it was assumed that the Japanese army's act was provocation against Korea, because they were going to the capital.
sen.cmt: ・アポストロフィが全角ですので修正しました。・in view of以降が不完全かつ不自然なため修正しました。・capital cityはthe capitalとしました。
sen.e: Sailing the rivers of foreign countries without permission is a violation of the international laws, and in this case, it was assumed that the Japanese army's act was provocation against Korea, because they were going to the capital.

sen.j: 朝鮮からの砲撃の翌日、今度は日本側が艦砲射撃を行った。
sen.e: In the day after Korea opened a fire, Japan did the bombardment of land by their warships, then they sent Naval Landing Forces and Marine Corps and Landing Forces of the Empire of Japan, set fire to the second gun battery, further, in the third day, they also fired the first gun battery and killed 35 of Korean.
On the day after Korea opened fire, Japan did the bombardment of land by their warships.
sen.cmt: ・in the day afterはon the day afterが適切です。・opened a fireのaは不要です。・一文が長いうえ、構造が不完全なため分割しました。・一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On the day after Korea opened fire, Japan did the bombardment of land by their warships.

sen.j: そのうえで、海軍陸戦隊と海兵隊大日本帝国陸海軍を上陸させて第2砲台を放火した。
sen.e: Then they sent Naval Landing Forces and Marine Corps and Landing Forces of the Empire of Japan to set fire to the second gun battery.
Then they sent Naval Landing Forces and Marine Corps and Landing Forces of the Empire of Japan to set fire to the second gun battery.

sen.j: 3日目には第1砲台も放火し、朝鮮側の35名を殺害している。
sen.e: On the third day, they also set fire to the first gun battery and killed 35 Korean soldiers.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・in the third dayはon the third dayが適切と思われます。・35 of Koreanはやや不自然に思われるため修正しました。・「放火」は前述の訳と合わせました。
sen.e: On the third day, they also set fire to the first gun battery and killed 35 Korean soldiers.

sen.j: 一方日本側の死傷者は雲揚の2名であった。
sen.e: On the other hand, the number of casualties for the Japanese was 2 of Unyo.
On the other hand, the number of casualties for the Japanese was 2 of Unyo.
On the other hand, the number of casualties for the Japanese was 2 of Unyo.

sen.j: この事件が朝鮮政府に与えた衝撃は大きく、変革を拒否する鎖国攘夷勢力の反対をおさえて日本との国交回復を検討することになり、翌1876年に日朝修好条規（江華条約）が締結された。
sen.e: This incident brought a terrible shock to the Korean government therefore they had to consider the recovery of the diplomatic relations with Japan surmounted all objections of the power of expulsion of foreigners, and concluded the Japanese-Korea Treaty of Amity (the Treaty of Ganghwa) on 1876.

This incident brought such a terrible shock to the Korean government that they had to consider the recovery of the diplomatic relations with Japan by surmounting all objections by the supporters of expulsion of foreigners, and concluded the Japanese-Korea Treaty of Amity (the Treaty of Ganghwa) in 1876.
sen.cmt: ・括弧の中の余分なスペースを削除しました。・複文のつなぎかたが不完全なため表現を変えました。・objections of the power of expulsionでは意味がわかりづらいため、「鎖国攘夷支持者の反対」と訳しました。・on 1876はin 1876です。
sen.e: This incident brought such a terrible shock to the Korean government that they had to consider the recovery of the diplomatic relations with Japan by surmounting all objections by the supporters of expulsion of foreigners, and concluded the Japanese-Korea Treaty of Amity (the Treaty of Ganghwa) in 1876.
